intro: Balsamorhiza deltoidea var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous balsamroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, lobed basal leaves and a tall, flowering stem that produces yellow composite flowers. The plant thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has a deep taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Its fibrous roots and dense foliage make it an important component of its ecosystem.
